title: Without A King
opening: During the battle for Talrega, Ike and the rest of his company come to a bleak realization. Wherever the Crimean army marches, the land becomes a battlefield. The damage is immense. Warfare and floodwaters claim homes, crops, and hope. Villagers seeking shelter and safety stumble blindly through the snow. To them, there is no doubt that the Crimeans are an invasion force.

However, the Crimeans have their own homeland to save. Focused as they are on that overriding goal, they cannot stop even to help the innocent victims of war. The only way they can help the people of Daein is to keep marching. The faster they reach Daein's capital of Nevassa and put an end to the war, the better for everyone.

intro.speaker: Kasatai
intro.line: What? Are you telling me that His Majesty has not yet returned?

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: Yes, sir! We've sent many messengers, but we have yet to receive any sort of official response.

intro.speaker: Kasatai
intro.line: The Crimean army is on our doorstep...What is His Highness thinking? If we want to protect the capital, we need a leader equal to one of the Four Riders. Just in case...

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: I'm sure the king has considered this.

intro.speaker: Kasatai
intro.line: Lady Ena! I don't understand how you're able to remain so calm!

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: Daein soldiers are the most elite warriors on the continent. In addition, our numbers are far superior to the Crimeans.

intro.speaker: Kasatai
intro.line: And, and yet they march on Nevassa! This is the Daein capital! If there's any danger of it falling into enemy hands, we can let nothing stop us from protecting it! No offense, Lady Ena, but as a general, I do not feel you're ready for such a vital command.

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: I...I think you are exactly right.

intro.speaker: Kasatai
intro.line: Th-then... When this command was given to you, why did you not firmly refuse?

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: Do you really think that wise, General? Would you refuse a direct order from the king?

intro.speaker: Kasatai
intro.line: Um...

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: ...Let me tell you something that I've discovered. If we are...unable to hold the capital, I do not believe the king will be all that upset. Ashnard does not hold a strong attachment to the country of Daein.

intro.speaker: Kasatai
intro.line: What are you talking about? Do you...Do you understand exactly what it is you are saying?

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: Yes.

intro.speaker: Kasatai
intro.line: Ridiculous! There isn't a monarch in the world who would not be moved by the loss of his own country! Such a preposterous notion is beyond comprehension!

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: General Kasatai. Do not avert your eyes from reality.

intro.speaker: Kasatai
intro.line: Reality? Ha! What reality is that? All I see is your guesswork.

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: Then tell me...why did the king suddenly order the invasion of Crimea?

intro.speaker: Kasatai
intro.line: As...as...sanctions for that nation choosing to ally itself with those evil and treacherous sub-humans.

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: On the surface, that would seem to be so. But doesn't the action strike you as odd? To apply sanctions properly, it would be necessary to speak with Begnion first. Begnion is the suzerain state, and Crimea answers to her. We needed Begnion's leave to make a formal declaration of war. Daein's disregard for that process made us a pariah in the eyes of our neighbors, and opened us to attack from all sides. And yet, not only did the king not do this, but he chose to invade without warning. It was the worst possible strategy. Furthermore, once the king conquered Crimea through strength of arms, he seized the castle and set up residence. And now he uses it as a stepping stone for an invasion of Gallia. Which means, the king's goal was never to apply sanctions, or even to defeat Crimea. If Ashnard moves against Gallia, it's easy to envision Phoenicis, Kilvas, and Goldoa joining the conflict. And if that happens, Begnion would be forced to ally itself with Daein rather than side with the sub-humans. Look where that leads us...A continent embroiled in war. Is that not the true desire of the king?

intro.speaker: Kasatai
intro.line: If... If you consider it in that way, your words do begin to make sense. Yet...to accomplish that, the citizens of Crimea would have to be sacrificed. That would be an act of madness!

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: Let's return to the topic at hand. The king has gained himself a new castle, and I believe he considers whatever land he occupies to be his kingdom. Daein and its people are already behind him. He need not look back.

intro.speaker: Kasatai
intro.line: Pah! If the king wished to rule the world, he would want as much military strength as possible! To forsake even a portion of the strength he currently possesses willingly, why, it would be sheer folly...

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: That doesn't matter. What's important is that we recognize the chance which Daein has been given. We must stop the Crimeans here. If we do not show the king our value, we are doomed. Make no mistake about it.

intro.speaker: Kasatai
intro.line: This is complete lunacy...

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: We will receive no reinforcements. We must hold nothing back. It is our only chance of survival.

intro.speaker: Kasatai
intro.line: This...I cannot... Why is this--

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: Be strong. The king has provided us, and the capital, with one final measure. We will use it to weather this storm. However, to use it, I need you, General Kasatai. Your cooperation is imperative. If you want to win, you must trust me.

intro.speaker: Kasatai
intro.line: ...Understood. In this time, let us cling to any hope we can find. Lady... No... General Ena, I place my trust in you.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: So this is the Daein capital, eh? If we can just defeat King Ashnard, this war will be over.

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: Ike... Here you are.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What is it, Nasir?

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: Are you sure that you have enough soldiers to lay siege to the capital? Your opponent is called Mad King Ashnard, after all. Who knows what sort of traps he has in store for you?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: He may indeed have something planned. Surely they've received reports of our advancement. Yet it's so quiet...

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: It looks like every able-bodied man has been conscripted into the army, while women and children have evacuated the area.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: We're not invaders. We wouldn't lay a hand on the citizenry...

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: There's no way for them to know that. They do know what their army did to the people of Crimea, however. If they fear they will be punished for that, I'm sure they decided to err on the side of caution.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: What? What happened to the Crimean people? Surely only the soldiers were imprisoned or killed...

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: ...You truly have no idea how to rule a nation. Do you know what happens to a country that loses a war? Everything is destroyed. Homes, land, crops...everything. And the citizens... They're not even treated as human. Crimeans, especially those near the capital where Daein's presence is strongest, are treated worse than sub-hum...than laguz.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: That's... Why would they...That's horrible...

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: The people understand this, which is why they pay for protection in the form of taxes. For the royals and nobles who are charged with protecting the people, there is no greater sin than to be defeated in war. It is the ultimate betrayal of the people's trust.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Sniff... Ah, by the goddess, I am a fool......Sniff...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Soren! Enough!

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Princess, be that as it may, the majority of people want to see the royal family restored to power. They believe that you will help them reclaim their old lives and restore peace.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Now it's time for us to throw down Ashnard and drive his army from Crimean soil. You're the only one who can do that. Do you understand?

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Yes...yes, I do. I... I will save the people of Crimea. This I swear.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: As I've said before, I won't be turned away. If there are traps, we just fight our way through. This war ends here!

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Yes! I'm with you all the way!

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: I hope it all goes as planned. I will do my best to make it so.

intro.speaker: Begnion Soldier
intro.line: General Ike! Sir, the castle gates are open!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: That's not good. What are they planning?

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: It must be a trap.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: This is unexpected. Making us lay siege would be far and away to their advantage. I have no idea what they're playing at.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Even so, we will not back down. Right, Ike?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Right. If we can't tell what they're planning, it matters not how we proceed. Let's just fight as we go. Move out! Keep your guard up, everyone!

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: Enemy troops have entered the castle!

intro.speaker: Kasatai
intro.line: They're moving already? Such recklessness! Don't they suspect a trap? I can't believe they've fallen for it.

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: Crimea follows a general named Ike. Perhaps he follows no procedure. Perhaps he relies solely on instinct.

intro.speaker: Kasatai
intro.line: I don't know if he's brave or merely reckless. It's unbelievable...

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: Regardless, we continue as planned. Close the gate and seal off their escape route. This contest will be decided here.

intro.speaker: Kasatai
intro.line: N-now then, it's time for the final measure you spoke of earlier. Will you show us what His Majesty left for us? What could possibly allow us to destroy an army in one fell swoop...provided we can herd them here?

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: General Kasatai...No matter what I show you, do not be shocked. You must continue to trust me without question.

intro.speaker: Kasatai
intro.line: I swear it. On my name as a royal knight of Daein, I will not betray you, General Ena.

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: Thank you...

intro.speaker: Kasatai
intro.line: Ge-General Ena! You're...

intro.speaker: Kasatai
intro.line: Aaaaaaah!

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: General Kasatai! Have you forgotten your vow? No matter what happens, we will protect the capital, yes?

intro.speaker: Kasatai
intro.line: Ah... Ah... Yes, of course...I...understand. This is His Majesty's--Why he left you here...

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: Yes.

intro.speaker: Kasatai
intro.line: We will win this battle! A legendary dragon of Goldoa is on our side! It is a powerful omen! Daein cannot lose! The Daein army is indestructible! We will crush the dogs of Crimea and use their skulls as goblets!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Stop, all of you! Get ahold of yourselves! You must not panic! No one has attacked!

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Ike!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Titania! Where is Princess Elincia?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: She's fine. She's with the supply convoy. They're all under very close guard.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Soren, is this the enemy trap?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: ...It could be...

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: If so, to what end?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Well, the goal obviously isn't to divide our troops and reduce our fighting strength. We're all packed in here together. Whatever they are planning, it appears that they want us all to experience it at the same time.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Daein must have something which they believe gives them an insurmountable advantage. Some kind of ultimate weapon.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: So they're absolutely sure they'll win, is that it? King Ashnard of Daein...You'll regret underestimating us.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: No matter what, we must be cautious. We can spare no efforts to protect the princess. We should put together an elite team and head for the throne room. Choose the members of this team with care. Everything will rest on their shoulders.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Understood.

battle.speaker: Ena
battle.line: I've been waiting for you. You are General Ike, are you not?

battle.speaker: Ena
battle.line: My name is Ena. By the orders of the king, I am the protector of this capital.

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: Withdraw. I've no desire to fight a useless battle with you. It's Ashnard I'm after.

battle.speaker: Ena
battle.line: I regret to inform you that the king is not here.

battle.speaker: Ena
battle.line: The king and the main body of the Daein army remain in Crimea, where they have been since it fell.

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: What are you saying? The king's abandoned the capital?

battle.speaker: Ena
battle.line: ...I share your desire to see this conflict end. So rather than see you travel to Crimea to fight Ashnard, I felt it would be much faster for me to defeat you and your army here. Don't you agree?

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: That's one way to look at it. The problem is that I'll never let you do as you please with Crimea!

battle.speaker: Ena
battle.line: We cannot have it both ways. We both want what is in our own interest, and that is why we have conflict. If neither one of us will yield, our conflict will continue until only the stronger of us remains. I have my own reasons for fighting...And I will see you fall.

boss.speaker: Kasatai
boss.line: For us there is no tomorrow. We cannot be beaten, nor can we withdraw! We must defeat the Crimean army and bring His Majesty back to us.

boss.speaker: Kasatai
boss.line: I cannot...stop your march...But...we are not yet defeated...General...Ena...Protect...the...capital...

recruit-battle.speaker: Ena
recruit-battle.line: If you had wished to extend your short life span, then you should not have appeared before me.

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: You are strong. I have lost.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Then calm yourself and surrender. There's no reason for you to die.

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: That I cannot do.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: What?

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: I... I must go to him...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: No! Wait!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Nasir! Good timing. Grab her, will you?

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: I'm sorry.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Nasir?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Urgh!

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: Ike!

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Nasir! What are you doing?

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: Go now. Hurry!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: So you were the traitor?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Someone's been giving information to the enemy. Was that you, too? And...Mist's medallion?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Are you telling me you've been working for Daein this whole time? But you're a laguz! Why? Talk to me! Ah, this is useless. Get him out of here! His traitorous face is making me ill!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Blast!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Until this has been cleared up, you'll be held in custody.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: I won't question you anymore. When you decide to talk, let me know.

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: ...Go to Palmeni Temple.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: What did you say?

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: So the capital's fallen, eh? Ha! I knew it would come to this! Still...how disappointing. It doesn't matter how well you train an army--if they don't fight, they become weak. What's the life of a soldier without a steady diet of war? Blood and pain are the foods of a true warrior!

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: Suh-speaking of soldiers, Your Highness...The majority of our forces have been moved here--

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: I left more than enough soldiers! And yet they could not prevail... I may have overestimated Ena. Even if she is a dragon, I suppose that was the best she could do.

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: I suppose...

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: But the important thing is the Black Knight. Where's he gotten to? Did you see him in the capital?

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: I did. He bid me present this to Your Majesty...

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: Ah! It's found its way back to my hands at long last. Unwrap it! Quickly! Unwrap it and show it to me...

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: V-very well--

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: Do be careful not to touch it, Petrine. It wouldn't do to have you go mad...I'd hate to have to kill you! Aha ha ha!

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: H-here it is, Y-Your Majesty...

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: Behold... Ah, how wonderful! See how it reacts to the war I have brought to this pathetic land?

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: Th-this is Lehran's Medallion?

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: Yes. And inside...inside is a dark god of immeasurable power and cruelty. It once caused a flood so great that all continents save Tellius were submerged in a watery tomb.

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: That...blue light...

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: You... Me... Even this very castle itself...We all radiate various forms of chaotic energy, and the dark god is pure chaos! The light you see is that energy calling out to the chaos around us. That is why some scholars refer to it as the Fire Emblem.

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: Heee! Heee har har! Look how you tremble! This light has the power to bewitch the human soul, you know? It calls to our chaotic impulses--like the urge to slaughter every living thing in sight... Do you feel its invitation? The permission to act on any base emotion that resides in your heart, no matter how unspeakable?

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: I... My report...is not...finished...

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: Heee har har! Ah, Petrine...Guard!

end.speaker: Daein Soldier
end.line: Yes, Your Highness?

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: Wrap the medallion and place it in the vault.

end.speaker: Daein Soldier
end.line: At once!

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: ...Go on. The report?

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: O-of course... Yes...As Your Majesty ordered, the Black Knight moves to capture Princess Serenes. At last report, he was on his way to Phoenicis.

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: I see. So he's decided on the princess and not the prince, eh? Did he give any reasons?

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: Yes, Your Highness. It was based on the findings of a group of scholars. Because the princess was isolated for over twenty years, they feel her magic will be stronger than her brother's.

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: Yet... Can the Black Knight outwit the hawk king of Phoenicis and steal her away?

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: The hawk king is not always at her side. Plus, as you know, the Black Knight is in possession of warp powder. If someone of his might has the ability to appear and disappear at will, it may be that he is without equal...W-with the exception of Your Majesty, of course!! I... I mean...

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: Ha ha. I will have to test that someday...But not today. It's not often that one finds a tool as useful as he is.

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: Well spoken, Your Majesty.

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: Now then, Petrine. My dear Petrine...You have made one blunder after another. How will you prove your worth to me...? If you wish to remain in my service, you must show me results. Unless you, too, wish to become food for Rajaion here?

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: Y-Your Majesty! I will redouble my efforts! I won't... I won't let you down again!

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: You can be a general or you can be dinner. I don't really care which... But do try to show a little initiative, won't you?

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: Yes, Your Highness... B-by your leave...

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: Hold. I forgot one thing. What happened to Ena when the capital fell?

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: According to all reports, she escaped. Her current location is unknown. However... This is Ena we're speaking of. She will return to Your Majesty, will she not?

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: Kill her.

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: What?

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: I've no further use for her. Oh, but if it's too much for you to kill her outright... Use her trust and stab her in the back.

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: As...as you wish...

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: Um, General? Thank you.

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: Hm?

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: The people of Talrega were the enemy, yet you treated them with kindness. I don't know how to thank you.

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: Oh, the provisions? It wasn't enough, but I wanted to do whatever I could. It's nothing for you to worry about, though.

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: General Ike...

conversation.speaker: Unknown
conversation.line: My, my lady! Is that you? Lady Fizzart?

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: Huh?

conversation.speaker: Woman
conversation.line: Oh, it is you! Lord Shiharam's lovely daughter! Thank heavens you're still alive!

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: You're...from Talrega.

conversation.speaker: Woman
conversation.line: That's right. I'm Sophie, from the village of Luma! I can't live there anymore, so I brought my two sisters here to the capital. After that battle, I was sure that you'd been claimed by the Dark Angel, just like Lord Shiharam. But here you are!

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: Is this your bodyguard? Ooo, so strong! You watch out for milady, you hear? She's Lord Shiharam's precious little girl! You keep an eye on her, and don't let those nasty Crimeans get near her!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Um...

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: Actually... We're...

conversation.speaker: Woman
conversation.line: Please listen to me, milady! We understand all about those floodgates! Lord Shiharam would've never done such a thing if he had any other choice! We know it was those Crimeans that did it! Why, when he wasn't on duty, Lord Shiharam and his men used to help us with the plowing and the planting. And once when my sister got sick, he loaded her up onto his own wyvern and brought her to the capital to see a doctor. He's the only one who ever cared about us country folk. He opened his heart to each and every one of us.

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: He... He was a good man...

conversation.speaker: Woman
conversation.line: Those dirty Crimeans are to blame! If they'd never come to Daein, that battle wouldn't have happened. And Lord Shiharam would still be with us.

conversation.speaker: Girl
conversation.line: Sister... I'm hungry...

conversation.speaker: Woman
conversation.line: You're going to be all right. I'll find you something to eat in a little while. Just be patient.

conversation.speaker: Girl
conversation.line: That soldier over there gave me this. Can I eat it?

conversation.speaker: Woman
conversation.line: Don't be stupid! Throw that away right now! We'll starve to death before we take charity from Crimean killers!

conversation.speaker: Girl
conversation.line: Waaaaaa...Waaaaaaaaaaaa!

conversation.speaker: Woman
conversation.line: Milady! The Crimean army is nearby! Run! You must escape and survive. We're gonna live. Even if we have to eat mud and weeds, we'll do it. And one day we'll have our revenge on those bloodthirsty Crimeans. If I can't do it, my children will...And if they can't, then my grandchildren will! We'll get them someday! I swear it! I have to go. Promise me, milady. You must go on for Lord Shiharam's sake. You mustn't get yourself killed!

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: Um...

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: ...S-sorry....Oh, I'm so sorry...

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Don't be...

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: ...Ike.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: ...Are you all right?

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: ...We've come a long way, haven't we? Do you think we can beat King Ashnard?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Of course we can! We have to. If we lose, Crimea may never be rebuilt.

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: ...What are we going to do, Brother? I'm...frightened... The medallion was my protection. Now that it's gone, my confidence has vanished.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Mist...

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: For as long as I can remember, I would talk to the medallion like I was talking to Mother. After Father died, I felt like I was talking to them both...Where could it have gone?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: We'll find it. And even though it's gone, Father and Mother are looking down on us and protecting us.

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: ... You're right... I'm sorry. Father and Mother are in my heart, and I've got you and everyone else at my side. So even without the medallion, I'm all right. Everything's going to turn out fine. I know it.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: That's the spirit.

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: Ike, Mist, if you're going to chat, why not go inside? Even if the snows are beginning to melt, it's still cold out here.

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: Oh, hi, Nasir.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You're right. I do feel a bit cold. Shall we go back to the tent?

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: Uh-huh! Let's go, Ike!  You, too, Nasir!

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: ...Forgive me.

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: Nasir? What's wrong? Hurry up!

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: Oh... Of course.
